titleStmt.title: William Howard to James F. Robinson
CWG1491

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p:
Madison Indiana
January 9, 1863 --
Hon Jas F. Robinson
Governor of Kentucky
Dr Sir

I see by a proclamation issued by your Honor the 250$ reward is offered for the apprehension & delivery of one William D. Mitchell, charged with the murder of one Fleet Goodridge Jr. Send me a Requisition on the Governor of Indiana and I am confident that I can capture and deliver at the jail of Henry County Kentucky said fugitive

Most Respectfully
William Howard
Marshall of the City of Madison
Jefferson County, Ind

Indiana
Requisition
for
W. D. Mitchell
Murder
in
Henry Co
Wm Howard
Agent
Issd. Jany 13, 1863
